## Validations

The current validation methods for aNCA are listed here:

-   **Code coverage \>95%.** You can check this either in our [GitHub README badge](https://github.com/pharmaverse/aNCA) or by running yourself `covr::package_coverage()` in our repository (after cloning)
-   **CI/CD workflow passing.** Testing package installation on Ubuntu () & Windows (), unit function tests and general documentation aspects (completeness, spelling...)
-   **CDISC outputs have been P21 tested.** Here you can see the successful reports for our dummy data example ().
-   **Internal company validations.** So far, we obtained a successfully validated report from Roche; see the [report]() and the [validation details](https://pharmar.org/posts/case-studies/roche-case-study/), also [here](https://static.sched.com/hosted_files/userconf2024/10/useR%21%202024%20Presentation.pdf?_gl=1*f3341l*_gcl_au*MTkxODk3NTU2OC4xNzYyMjQwNjMz*FPAU*MTkxODk3NTU2OC4xNzYyMjQwNjMz)
-   **Parameter calculations done using the PKNCA.** This R package has already been used for FDA submission, for more details about it click [here](https://github.com/humanpred/pknca).

If you feel something is missing or have ideas on how to improve the validation process, Weâ€™d love to hear your feedback, check [this issue](https://github.com/pharmaverse/aNCA/issues/539) and comment!

## Additional validations planned for 2026

Among our new plans will be

-   **Automate CI/CD CDISC standard testings** in the outputs
-   **Polish our end-to-end Shiny App tests** (there is an ongoing draft)
-   **Consider other testing types**: fuzzing, chaos, sensibility...
-   **OS risk assessment evaluation** metrics based on popular packages created for this
-   **Join CRAN** to increase the number of users testing the App
-   **Improve App documentation** (i.e, tutorials) so new users can test all the App options
